DataElement.preferredName: Stage Two Day Six Biopsy Specimen Collection Performed Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response to a question that asks if Stage 2/Day 6 biopsy specimen collection was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Two Day Six Biopsy Specimen Collection Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any distinct time period in a sequence of events._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one._Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Stage Two Day Six Biopsy Specimen
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.:A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.       :A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: Any distinct time period in a sequence of events.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
